result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Tony Ray Watson was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Paid in Full - Cash Bond previously posted has been applied.
Paid in Full - Cash Bond previously posted has been applied.

Huber Privileges and Good Time Credit granted.    Pursuant to s. 346.65(7), Wis. Stats., Defendant shall be required to remain in the County Jail for not less than a 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for huber.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony Ray Watson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:51 PM: Defendant Tony Ray Watson in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited on OWI 2 with argued terms on sentencing.  Def agrees with State's recital.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  No restitution requested - property replaced.  Plea (OWI 2):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 dismissed outright.  15TR-657 DRI.  Argument by ADA - recommends SEH guidelines.  Statement by Def:  Yes - requests Huber and report date after 7/20/2015.  The Court:  Will accept agreement reached - Imposes:  17 days WCJ, Report:  7/20/15 at 8:00 PM, Huber and GT credit, 1 day TS credit; 48 continuous period of service prior to release for Huber must be served; $1505 fine, includes DNA surcharge and sample to be provided; 14 mos DL Rev/IID for 14 mos effective today.  Appeal Rights Given.  Waiting period of OCC DL application commences today.  IID exemption process for Wysocki vehicles explained to Defendant.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Tony Ray Watson in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
To defendant with cash bond to be signed and returned.

Status conference at 06-08-2015 02:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 05-20-2015 11:45 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

15CM-122 and 15TR-657 - Both Cases Called @ 2:40 PM: Defendant Tony Ray Watson in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Def does not wish counsel.   NGP received and entered as to both matters.  Def states he has paid for damages as to civil matter.   PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 11:45 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
